21  import numpy as np 
22   

23 -def assert_vectors_correlated(actual, desired, targetCorrelation=0.95): 

24      """ 
25      Assert that the correlation between two column vector arrays is greater 
26      than a specified target. 
27   
28      Correlations calculated as the diagonal of the upper right quadrant of 
29      the full correlation matrix. Each of the diagonal elements of this 
30      sub-matrix represents the correlation between an actual vector component 
31      and its corresponding desired value. 
32   
33      @param actual: Actual column vector array. 
34      @param desired: Desired column vector array. 
35      @param targetCorrelation: Minimum correlation to accept. 
36      """ 
37      correlationMatrix = np.corrcoef(actual, desired) 
38      s = correlationMatrix.shape[0] / 2 
39      correlationMatrix = correlationMatrix[s:, :s] 
40      correlations = np.diag(correlationMatrix) 
41   
42      assert np.all(correlations > targetCorrelation), "Vectors are not " \ 
43      "sufficiently correlated. \nCorrelation values: %s\nTarget %.2f"\ 
44          %(correlations, targetCorrelation) 

45
